alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 8:21PM MDT until June 26 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Carter County in southeastern Montana... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 820 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Camp Crook, or 30 miles southeast of Ekalaka, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. Torrential rainfall was also occurring with this storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Be alert for water over the roads. * Locations impacted include... Capitol. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
